snippet: Liu Zhijun, 60, a former minister of railways, confessed to taking millions in bribes in return for providing access to China’s huge spending on its train network expansion.
abstract: Court in Beijing gives Liu Zhijun, former Chinese minister of railways, suspended death sentence after finding him guilty of taking bribes and abusing his powers; sentence is final act in Liu’s downfall, which exposed graft and cronyism at the heart of China’s rail expansion.
lead_paragraph: Liu Zhijun, 60, a former minister of railways, confessed to taking millions in bribes in return for providing access to China’s huge spending on its train network expansion.

headline.main: Ex-Rail Minister in China Gets a Suspended Death Sentence
